mse.channel[:].active_spatial_resolution.documentation: Full width of the spatially resolved zone in the R, Z and phi directions

mse.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].centre.phi_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "phi"

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].x1_unit_vecto.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].x3_unit_vecto.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

mse.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)

mse.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

mse.channel[:].detector.centre.r_error_i.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

mse.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

mse.channel[:].detector.centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the center of the circle. If geometry_type=1, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

mse.channel[:].detector.geometry_type.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

mse.channel[:].line_of_sight.second_poin.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].x1_unit_vecto.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].x2_unit_vecto.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].outline.x2_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x2"

mse.channel[:].active_spatial_resolution.documentation: Position of the centre of the spatially resolved zone

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].centre.r_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].outline.x1_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1"

mse.ids_properties.creation_date.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].x2_unit_vecto.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

mse.ids_properties.homogeneous_time.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].x3_unit_vecto.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

mse.channel[:].line_of_sight.second_poin.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "phi"

mse.channel[:].detector.x3_unit_vector.y.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

mse.channel[:].active_spatial_resolution.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

mse.channel[:].polarisation_angle_validi.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the polarisation_angle data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used

mse.channel[:].active_spatial_resolution.documentation: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse)

mse.channel[:].detector.outline.x1_error.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1"

mse.channel[:].detector.x1_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is horizontal and oriented is the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when seen from above).

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].radius_error_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "radius"

mse.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

mse.channel[:].aperture.documentation: Description of a set of collimating apertures

Index in the error_description list for "z"

mse.channel[:].detector.centre.phi_error.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "phi"

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the center of the circle. If geometry_type=1, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].x3_unit_vecto.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

mse.channel[:].detector.x1_unit_vector.x.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"

mse.channel[:].aperture[:].geometry_type.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

mse.channel[:].detector.x2_unit_vector.y.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "y"

mse.channel[:].polarisation_angle.data_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

mse.channel[:].active_spatial_resolution.documentation: Set of 9 geometric coefficients providing the MSE polarisation angle as a function of the local electric and magnetic field components (these are related to the angle between beam and line of sight). The list is ordered as follows : coefficients of BZ, BR, Bphi, ER (numerator of the MSE angle expression); coefficients of BZ, BR, Bphi, ER, EZ (denominator)

mse.channel[:].detector.radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2

The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.
